Patient Particulars: Name: Sharon; Age: 28 years; Marital status: Unmarried
Referral Information: Referred from a counsellor; Reason for referral: Risk assessment
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Depressed mood
2. Ideas of unworthiness
3. Ideas and acts of self harm and suicide 
4. Feelings of loneliness 
5. Worries about future misfortunes
History: Present history: Patient lost his job around 2 months ago which keeps him under stress. He is unable to manage his expenses to the point that his apartment may get seized; Past history: He was earlier diagnosed with depression and had experienced anxiety; Family history: Patient shares a strained relation with his mother; Personal history: Occupation- He used to work at a gas station earlier; Substance use history: He consumes alcohol 3 to 4 times a week.
Crisis Markers: Suicidal ideations (active): He has initiated the attempts once or twice recently. He also has. a rough plan for it; Suicide attempt: Patient tried committing suicide 4 years ago by cutting his wrist; Family history: Patient's father had committed suicide 15 years ago, his sister attempted to commit suicide.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Rapport could be established and patient was cooperative. Mood: Dysphoric; Affect: restricted; Thought: Content- Ideas of hopelessness and worthlessness, Judgement: Personal judgement was impaired.
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient's intent and plan about suicide were tapped upon. He had been feeling extremely low and hopeless about losing his job and his alcohol intake has also increased.
Reflections by the therapist: Patient was able to trust the therapist and rapport was established. It was observed that patient disapproves the idea of suicide but also felt as if it were the only option left for him.
Action Plan: There will be discussion with the referrer (counselor) to formulate a plan to keep the patient safe.
